moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. d4: Scotch game. I play the Scotch to avoid book lines and develop my own theories in chess. It is good to know self knowledge when your in middle and end games.
moves.4... Bg4: I believe it is not best to go munching on pawns at this moment
moves.5. Bb5: Pining the knight and preparing to castle king side.  If I played pawn exd6 he could capture with the queen or bishop and would then be in the lead of development. This is the start of my squeezing my opponent
moves.5... Bxf3 6. Qxf3 dxe5 7. O-O Qd7 8. Rd1: Two pieces pined! Squeezing him! His are going to be cramp up in this game
moves.9. Qg3: I do not know if there was a better continuation of the game.
moves.10. Nc3: And with this move I thought well it is better to start with moving the queen's knight than the bishop. Still, I was unsure on how to proceed the game.
moves.10... Nge7: When black moved his knight here I had a idea
moves.11. Nd5: If he played Nxd5 I recapture with my e pawn and win the c6 knight on the next move!
moves.11... O-O-O: ?! I believe it was safer on the king side
moves.12. Nxe7+: I am going to give hime double pawns
moves.13. Bxc6 bxc6: The opening of his castled position
moves.16... f5: ?? His losing move, leading to his down fall
moves.18. exf5: A "swhzinzzenshoe" or in-between move! Another combination!
